results.title: Federal highway
results.creator_credit: Michael Healy, British Road Federation and Richard Costain Film Unit
results.brief_description: A tour of West Germany to inspect the rapidly developing trunk road and urban motorway system. Through the Rhineland from Frankfurt to Cologne, then to Hamburg and Berlin, we see some of the road and bridge works. Aerial views of complex autobahn junctions and intersections which cannot be appreciated from the ground.

results.title: Fatal compromise
results.creator_credit: Josef Gemes and MAFILM Pannonia Filmstudio
results.brief_description: A superbly animated production that details the lengths to which a love-smitten hedgehog will go in order to gain the attention of a rather large feline character. However the hedgehog does not quite get what it bargained for. Suitable for primary school level.
results.description: A superbly animated production that details the lengths to which a love-smitten hedgehog will go in order to gain the attention of a rather large feline character. However the hedgehog does not quite get what it bargained for. Suitable for primary school level.

results.title: Fat of the land
results.creator_credit: Edmond Levy, Medcom and Searle Educational Systems
results.brief_description: Documentary on obesity, its causes and effects. Psychiatrists suggest that over-eating is a form of emotional disorder leading to addiction and that in the United States in particular, food has become symbolic as a state of well-being. It appears that children are actually encouraged to over-eat leading to difficulties in adult life to break the habit. The program’s main aim is to educate in the area of health and nutrition.

results.title: Fast film
results.brief_description: This ingenious cut out animation is the chase film to end all chase films. Borrowing images and characters from various Hollywood classics, ‘Fast film’ then distorts and twists our understanding of where these icons of Hollywood folklore belong. Ultimately mutating into a new narrative where the suave Cary Grant and Frankenstein’s monster happily co-exist side by side.

results.title: Fashion from start to finish
results.brief_description: Butterick, “Vogue” and “See’n Sew” are together the world’s largest pattern house. The film examines the role of each person involved in the design and manufacture of patterns. An advertisment for “Butterick”, but a fast-moving comprehensive coverage. No other credits. Suitable for middle and upper secondary levels.

results.title: Farnborough Air Show (1949)
results.brief_description: The Society of Aircraft Constructors’ Show at Farnborough, England, in 1949, is described in detail. The various types of new British aircraft are shown being put through their paces. Commentary by Leslie Mitchell.

results.title: Farming 2000
results.brief_description: Covers a conference held in 1983 by the Australian Rural Adjustment Unit and the National Farmers Federation. The conference examined the major issues facing rural Australia during the 1980’s.

results.title: Farm tractor safety
results.brief_description:
Produced by the U.S Department of Agriculture. Follows a community as they confront the high amount of tractor-related injuries that are occuring and discover ways to counter them.

Largely set at a town meeting where addresses are given by various experts on the dangers of tractors and how to operate them safely. This culminates in an address by a man who lost both his hands in an accident.

Film contains numerous shots of tractors toppling over in varying situations.

results.title: Farm boy of Hungary
results.creator_credit: Gabor Kalman and Vue Touristique Film Studios
results.brief_description: The pace, feel, and values of the rural way of life that is still a part of Central Europe today. Lajos, a farm boy, is shown living the normal life in Hungary. Modern conveniences may be lacking, but Lajos and his family “have everything we need”.
